title: Teen Mom 2’s Kailyn Lowry Says She ‘Can’t Wait to Meet’ Baby No. 3 — and Shares Photos of Her Ultrasound!
text:
Kailyn Lowry “can’t wait” for the day when she welcomes her third baby into the world!
The Teen Mom 2 star revealed in a blog post in February that she is pregnant with her third child.
â€œIf youâ€™ve googled my name the past few weeks, the speculation of so many things have surfaced â€“ no one knows whatâ€™s true, whatâ€™s false and what really goes on in my day-to-day life. SinceÂ everyone canâ€™t wait for theÂ confirmation; here it goes. I am pregnant,â€ the post read.
â€œPlease know this was a choice I made, I already know some wonâ€™t agree but Iâ€™ve been showered with support by the ones I love since I found out. Why did I wait? Iâ€™ve had a lot of health complications leading up to this pregnancy and I was not ready to release such private information on my own just yet being that I am so high risk with this pregnancy. I didnâ€™t want to announce just to have another miscarriage and suffer through another grief,â€ the post continued.
On Thursday, the MTV star shared an adorable Instagram post that featured her ultrasound photos next to a notebook for “baby memories & milestones.”
“I can’t wait to meet you,” the expecting mom captioned the sweet photo.
I can't wait to meet you 
A post shared by Kailyn Lowry (@kaillowry) on Mar 30, 2017 at 6:43am PDT

Lowry, 25, is already mom to Isaac Elliot, 7, whom she shares with ex-boyfriend Joe Rivera,Â and sonÂ Lincoln Marshall, 3, whom sheÂ shares with ex-husband Javi Marroquin.
Though her third childâ€™s father is currently unknown, she onlyÂ recently finalized her divorce from Javi. The pair married in a small ceremony in 2012Â at a Pennsylvania courthouse before heÂ had to report back to Air Force duty. They then planned a larger wedding a year later when Lowry was pregnant with Lincoln.
On the last season ofÂ Teen Mom 2 , it was revealed that Lowry had suffered a miscarriage in 2015 with what would have been, her and Javiâ€™s second baby together. She opened up to PEOPLE, prior to the show airing, saying, â€œI like to think that everything kind of happened for a reason â€“ Iâ€™m not really sure what the reason was yet for that, but Iâ€™m just constantly reminding myself that there was a reason why this happened.â€
